document_info.facility_address: 635 Madison Avenue, Suite 1400, New York, NY 10022

accident_info.accident_description: Rear-end collision while stopped at traffic light

chief_complaint: Persistent neck and back pain, left arm numbness and tingling
history_of_present_illness: Patient returns for follow-up, now 1 month post-MVA. She reports persistent neck pain rated 7/10, radiating into left shoulder and arm with associated numbness in the left 4th and 5th digits. Low back pain rated 6/10 with radiation into left buttock and posterior thigh. She has completed 8 sessions of physical therapy with minimal improvement. She reports difficulty sleeping due to pain and has been unable to return to work as an administrative assistant due to inability to sit for prolonged periods.

injuries.description: Central-left paracentral disc herniation at C5-C6 causing left C6 nerve root compression
Broad-based disc bulge at L4-L5 with annular tear and left foraminal narrowing

imaging_findings.findings: C5-C6: Central-left paracentral disc herniation measuring 4mm, causing moderate left neural foraminal narrowing and left C6 nerve root compression. C4-C5: Mild disc bulge without significant stenosis. C6-C7: Small central disc protrusion.
imaging_findings.impression: C5-C6 disc herniation with left C6 radiculopathy. Recommend clinical correlation and consider interventional treatment.

imaging_findings.findings: L4-L5: Broad-based disc bulge with superimposed left paracentral protrusion and high signal in the posterior annulus suggesting annular tear. Mild left neural foraminal narrowing. L5-S1: Mild disc desiccation without significant herniation.
imaging_findings.impression: L4-L5 disc bulge with annular tear and mild left L5 radiculopathy.

imaging_findings.findings: Abnormal study showing evidence of left C6 radiculopathy with active denervation in C6 innervated muscles.
imaging_findings.impression: Electrophysiologic evidence of left C6 radiculopathy, moderate severity.

treatment_provided.description: C5-C6 transforaminal epidural steroid injection under fluoroscopic guidance

findings: Cervical paraspinal tenderness and spasm, worse on left
Spurling test positive on left with reproduction of arm symptoms
Positive straight leg raise left at 40 degrees

work_restrictions: Unable to work at this time
activity_restrictions: Limit driving to essential trips only

referrals.reason: Evaluation for possible surgical intervention if conservative treatment fails

follow_up.instructions: Continue physical therapy 3x/week. May need additional injection or surgical consultation if symptoms persist.

prognosis: Guarded to poor for complete recovery. Patient has documented disc herniations with radiculopathy confirmed on EMG. She may require surgical intervention if conservative treatment fails. Some permanent limitation of cervical and lumbar spine function is anticipated.
causation_statement: Based on my examination, review of imaging, and the temporal relationship between the MVA and symptom onset, it is my medical opinion that the cervical and lumbar disc injuries are causally related to the motor vehicle accident of 03/15/2024.

supporting_language: MRI-confirmed C5-C6 disc herniation with radiculopathy
56-67% loss of cervical ROM persisting beyond 30 days
Unable to work since accident (now 30+ days)
